terms.definition: a fruit with a red or green skin and a whitish interior.
a long curved fruit that grows in clusters and has soft pulpy flesh and yellow skin when ripe.
a domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, and a barking, howling, or whining voice.
a limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins living wholly in water.
a large African mammal with a very long neck and forelegs, having a coat patterned with brown patches separated by lighter lines.
a sweet yellowish or brownish fluid produced by various bees from the nectar of flowers.
a sweet frozen food typically eaten as a snack or dessert.
a type of music of black American origin characterized by improvisation, syncopation, and usually a regular or forceful rhythm.
a large herbivorous marsupial native to Australia.
a yellow citrus fruit with an acidic taste.
a large landform that rises prominently above its surroundings.
a book with blank pages for writing notes.
a large body of saltwater that covers most of the Earth's surface.
a dish consisting of a flat, round base of dough topped with tomato sauce, cheese, and various toppings.
the female ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position by right of birth.
a cylindrical projectile that can be propelled to a great height or distance by the combustion of its contents.
a tall North American plant of the daisy family, with very large golden-rayed flowers.
a woody perennial plant, typically having a single stem or trunk supporting branches and leaves.
